text: Ramen noodles are a student staple but it can get boring
So Ben is going to show us a great way to spice them up with some teriyaki flavouring
So this teriyaki ramen dish uses tiger prawns, raw at the moment, we'll cook those out in a second
some bean sprouts, some mange tout, and a kind of teriyaki flavour
which means you're adding nutrition, health and loads of extra flavour to an otherwise
fairly boring dish

We'll start with our noodles..
There's almost 'Super' you could say
Yes, some of them are very super... So a sachet of our flavouring with our noodles
into boiling water for about three minutes
While they're bubbling away
we can make
our dressing, so if I give you a fork
and whisk together a tablespoon of sesame oil
a very big tablespoon, but that's fine!
three tablespoons of mirin, one two three
same again of soy sauce, a little drizzle of honey so if you could
put a little drizzle of that in
also we can add our three flavours, our ginger, chilli and garlic... and we'll just take a little bit of that
just grate it

Skin and all?
Absolutely, for this not a problem at all
a couple of cloves of garlic
and we do want a little bit of spice to this as well, so I'm going to chop up a red chilli
quite chunky strips and that way if you see them and you want to you

can pick them out... But I quite like a bit of heat in this dish
Yeah, got to have it a bit hot!
So, chilli's going to go in there
There's about a teaspoon in total of grated ginger
and if we just scrape those little bits of garlic off there
If you can give that a quick whisk up, that's going to become our dressing
While you're doing that, our noodles are there already
We can see, they are cooked
we're going to cook them again in a second, so we don't want them overly done. So just drain those off
Last few things we need to do quickly is heat up our wok
you want that a really hot heat because that's what we're
going to put our prawns into, now these are raw prawns
you could use cooked prawns
Just throw them in at the last minute. But if they're raw obviously they need
to go in quite early on
a little bit of oil

And what kind of oil is this?
A groundnut oil which means you can fry it at a much higher temperature
But you can use any sort of vegetable oil really, and then our prawns can go in
Now while they are busy in there, Jamie we're going to do the spring onions

and mange tout.
So mange tout
means 'eat all', so we don't need to worry about
peeling them or anything, we just want to cut them in half
so if you could literally take those and cut them in half like that
So they become
a similar shape to our bean sprouts
And I'll do the same with the spring onions
Remember to keep those prawns moving
This is a stir fry after all, so keep that moving as you're cooking!
As soon as your prawns have turned pink
we can add in our mange tout
a handful of our bean sprouts
and our spring onions, so everything else goes in
look at how much fresh veg we're adding to this, so we're not going to cook it for very long at all
it means you're going to keep all that crunch
Now obviously we don't want to overcook those prawns, so at this stage
we want all that crunch from the veg as well, our noodles can go back in with all of that sauce

Beautiful!
And now it's just a case of bringing it together and heating it right up.

You really start to get all those smells now.
Yes, all those spices and the ginger and garlic come through
Jamie, if you can just hack up some coriander... You can see how speedy this is
From boiling water straight out of a kettle, noodles, a whole stir fry

All done in about 6 minutes so...
Perfect for a mid-week meal or something like that.
Absolutely. And your prawns can be in the freezer, so you can take those out
and just defrost them

it's all ready to go! Now at this point we'll taste it
because we can always amend at this time
I love sesame oil personally, so I might add a little more but we'll see how we go
Actually, sweet enough - nice bit of honey
Nice bit of spice, so there we go - it's as quick and as easy as that
it's something more interesting to do with Ramen Noodles, our Prawn Teriyaki Noodle - SORTED

Ah, that sauce is amazing!
And because of all that extra eg, although it's one bag of noodles it feeds two
So elegant Jamie, so elegant
I hope you enjoyed this, remember go to the website, there is a brand new video recipe
every single day
of the week of the month of the year
something for everybody to enjoy
